MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Permission to Sit for Examination.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. E. O'Keeffe Mr. E. O'Keeffe
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education if she will consider allowing a person (details supplied) in County Cork who is studying for her intermediate certificate examination, will not be fourteen years until 11 April 1983, and is an excellent pupil, to sit the examination; and if not, the reason.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. Hussey) Gemma Hussey
Speaker.P: The rules governing the age of transfer to post-primary school and of entry to the certificate examinations were drawn up after consultation with the various interested bodies. The rules allow the Intermediate Certificate Examination to be taken at 14½ years and the Leaving Certificate Examination as early as 16½ years of age. It would not be in the best interests of pupils generally that exceptions such as that involved in this pupil's application should be made.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. H. Byrne Mr. H. Byrne
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education if she will give details of the number and names of those schools affected by her decision to bring the vice-principal within the quota in (i) secondary, (ii) community, (iii) vocational and (iv) comprehensive schools.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. Hussey) Gemma Hussey
Speaker.P: The number of schools with enrolment of less than 250 pupils in which a post of vice-principal exists is as follows:—
Secondary, 123; Vocational, 109; Comprehensive and Community, nil.
It would not be in accordance with normal practice to identify the schools by name.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. G. Collins Mr. G. Collins
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education the present position in regard to the provision of an all-purpose room for the national school in Glin, County Limerick.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. Hussey) Gemma Hussey
Speaker.P: Sketch-plans have been approved for the provision of a general purposes room and ancillary accommodation at Glin National School, County Limerick. Agreement has been reached with the chairman concerning the local contribution towards the cost of the project and a grant will be sanctioned at an early date.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - European Social Fund Training Scheme.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Mac Giolla Mr. Mac Giolla
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education if, arising from the statement contained in the document Principal Features of the Budget, she will indicate by how much it is intended to reduce the grants available to students under the European Social Fund training scheme; and from what date it is intended to implement the reduction.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Mac Giolla Mr. Mac Giolla
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education the proportion of a grant paid to a student under the European Social Fund training scheme which is met from (a) Government and (b) EEC funds.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. Hussey) Gemma Hussey
Speaker.P: I propose to take questions Nos. 568 and 569 together.

The amount of the maintenance grant under the higher education grants scheme is differentiated on the basis of residence in or outside the environs of a university or other third level institution. In future, the maintenance element under the ESF grants scheme will be differentiated on the same basis. The European Social Fund recoups 55 per cent of expenditure on approved courses.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Mac Giolla Mr. Mac Giolla
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education if, arising from the statement contained in the document Principal Features of the Budget, she will indicate by how much it is intended to increase fees for students in regional technological colleges and technological colleges; and from what date the increases will be implemented.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. O'Rourke Mrs. O'Rourke
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education if she proposes to increase the fee levels in regional technical colleges; and, if so, by how much.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. Hussey) Gemma Hussey
Speaker.P: I propose to take questions Nos. 570 and 571 together.

It is my intention that there will be discussions with representatives of the management authorities concerned before the issue of an official circular in this matter. Accordingly, I am not in a position at present to make a detailed statement in relation to such increases in the fees as will be introduced in respect of students of the colleges in question. The normal practice is that an increase in fees is introduced with effect from the commencement of the next school year.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. G. Collins Mr. G. Collins
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education the up-to-date position in regard to the availability of grants for the new post-primary school at Kilfinnan, County Limerick.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. Hussey) Gemma Hussey
Speaker.P: The outline sketch scheme for the new post-primary school for Scoil Pól, Kilfinane, County Limerick has been approved and the Department are awaiting the submission by the school authorities of the developed sketch scheme.
The question of making a grant available will not arise until the project is at the tender stage.

Speaker.hpid: Miss Harney Miss Harney
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education if, in view of the fact that St Mark's Community School, Fortunestown Lane, Tallaght, Co. Dublin, cannot cater sufficiently for the numbers in the west Tallaght area of County Dublin who wish to avail themselves of post primary education, she will provide additional post-primary educational facilities in this area.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. Hussey) Gemma Hussey
Speaker.P: In addition to St. Mark's Community School, Springfield and Killinarden Community School, planning is well advanced for two further post-primary schools in the west Tallaght area at Brookfield and Jobstown. My Department are satisfied that this provision will be adequate to meet the future needs in the area.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Westmeath School Catchment Boundary Facilities.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. O'Rourke Mrs. O'Rourke
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education if her Department are aware of the serious implications of the catchment boundary facility charges for a school (details supplied) in County Westmeath and if she will initiate a special review of the catchment boundary facilities in relation to this school.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. Hussey) Gemma Hussey
Speaker.P: Charges for incidental catchment boundary facilities are of general application in relation to all post-primary centres.

My Department do not consider that a special review is warranted of the catchment boundary facilities at present operating in the case of pupils attending the school mentioned by the Deputy. However, if the school authorities feel that particular circumstances exist in this regard, it is open to them to submit a case to the Department.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Junior Cycle Transport Fee.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. O'Rourke Mrs. O'Rourke
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education if she will consider waiving the junior cycle transport fee in the case of persons (details supplied) in County Longford as this family has particular social circumstances which warrant examination and sympathetic consideration.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. Hussey) Gemma Hussey
Speaker.P: I would refer the Deputy to my statement of 22 February 1983, in which it is proposed to make arrangements for the exemption of certain junior cycle pupils whose parents would face particular hardship in meeting the charge and for whom the use of school transport is essential to enable them to make satisfactory school attendance.

MainHeading.P: The position of the pupil in question will be considered under these arrangements.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Proposed Education Cuts Effects.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. S. Brennan Mr. S. Brennan
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education the schools in the Dublin South constituency in which it is expected that there will be a loss of (a) career guidance teachers; (b) clerical assistants; (c) vice-principals and (d) other staff as a result of the proposed education cuts; and the number involved in each case.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. Hussey) Gemma Hussey
Speaker.P: I would refer the Deputy to my reply to questions Nos. 1 and 3 of 23 February 1983 dealing with the matter of the appointment of teachers in secondary, vocational, comprehensive and community schools.

I am not in a position to state what arrangements school authorities in Dublin South constituency will make in relation to the appointment of teachers in their respective schools in 1983-84. There will, of course, be no reduction in the number of vice-principal posts and I do not accept the implication in the question that suitable arrangements will not continue to be made for guidance teaching in all schools in the area in question. Posts as clerical assistants will be phased out only as vacancies occur. I am not in a position to state in which schools such vacancies may occur or the number of such vacancies.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. L.T. Cosgrave Mr. L.T. Cosgrave
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education when funds will be provided for the proposed extension to St. Bridget's School, Stillorgan, County Dublin.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. Hussey) Gemma Hussey
Speaker.P: It is understood from the Commissioners of Public Works that a revised drawing and cost plan for the replacement of St. Bridget's national school, Stillorgan, has been received recently from the chairman's architect and my Department await a report on these documents. The question of sanctioning a grant does not arise at this early stage of planning.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. R. Bruton Mr. R. Bruton
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education whether provision is being made in the 1983 Public Capital Programme for the replacement of a pre-fab and the erection of a computer room at the Convent of Mercy, Beaumont, Dublin 9.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. Hussey) Gemma Hussey
Speaker.P: Planning of an extension to the Convent of Mercy Secondary School, Beaumont, Dublin, has been initiated and an outline sketch scheme is awaited from the school authorities, which will provide for the replacement of pre-fabricated rooms and the provision of facilities for accommodating a micro-computer.
